Submodules¶

modules.surfaces.console module¶

The console module provides ADVISER modules that access the console for input and output.

class ConsoleInput(domain: utils.domain.domain.Domain = None, subgraph: dict = None, logger: utils.logger.DiasysLogger = <DiasysLogger adviser (NOTSET)>, language: utils.common.Language = None)[source]¶

Bases: modules.module.Module

Gets the user utterance from the console.

Waits for the built-in input function to return a non-empty text.

initial_turn¶

whether or not this is the first time that the forward function is called

Type

bool

forward(dialog_graph: dialogsystem.DialogSystem, **kwargs) → {'user_utterance': <class 'str'>}[source]¶

Forward function inherited from Module interface.

If this function has not been called before, do not pass a message. Otherwise, it blocks the application until the user has entered a valid (i.e. non-empty) message in the console.

Parameters

  • dialog_graph (DialogSystem) – The dialog system this module is part of. Useful to access other modules, turn and dialog counters etc.

  • **kwargs (dict) – Dictionary of information passing across modules, keys and values are defined according to the modules’ definition and interaction

Returns

a dict containing the user utterance which is automatically added

to the kwargs

Return type

dict

class ConsoleOutput(domain: utils.domain.domain.Domain = None, subgraph: dict = None, logger: utils.logger.DiasysLogger = <DiasysLogger adviser (NOTSET)>)[source]¶

Bases: modules.module.Module

Writes the system utterance to the console.

forward(dialog_graph: dialogsystem.DialogSystem, sys_utterance: str = None, sys_act: str = None, **kwargs) → {}[source]¶

Forward function inherited from Module interface.

The message is simply printed to the console.

Parameters

  • dialog_graph (DialogSystem) – The dialog system this module is part of. Useful to access other modules, turn and dialog counters etc.

  • sys_utterance (str) – The system utterance, as added to the kwargs by the NLG module

  • **kwargs (dict) – Dictionary of information passing across modules, keys and values are defined according to the modules’ definition and interaction

Returns

an empty dict, since nothing is added to the kwargs

Return type

dict

Raises

ValueError – if there is no system utterance to print

modules.surfaces.gui module¶

The GUI module provides ADVISER modules that can access the GUI.

class Feedback(domain: utils.domain.domain.Domain = None, subgraph: dict = None, logger: utils.logger.DiasysLogger = <DiasysLogger adviser (NOTSET)>)[source]¶

Bases: modules.module.Module

Displays the feedback inside the GUI (for user evaluation)

The module blocks while the user completes the form. It will automatically appear at the end of a dialogue.

dialogs¶

dialogue counter

Type

int

forward(dialog_graph: dialogsystem.DialogSystem, sys_act: utils.sysact.SysAct = None, **kwargs) → {}[source]¶

Forward function inherited from Module interface.

If this function is called and the user just entered a ‘Bye’ action, this method will display the feedback form and block while the user completes the form.

Parameters

  • dialog_graph (DialogSystem) – The dialog system this module is part of. Useful to access other modules, turn and dialog counters etc.

  • sys_act (SysAct) – The system act, to check whether the dialogue was finished

  • **kwargs (dict) – Dictionary of information passing across modules, keys and values are defined according to the modules’ definition and interaction

Returns

an empty dict, since nothing is added to the kwargs

Return type

dict

class GuiInput(domain=None, subgraph: dict = None, logger: utils.logger.DiasysLogger = <DiasysLogger adviser (NOTSET)>)[source]¶

Bases: modules.module.Module

Gets the user utterance from the GUI.

Waits for the GUI to return the user’s message.

initial_turn¶

whether or not this is the first time that the forward function is called

forward(dialog_graph: dialogsystem.DialogSystem, **kwargs) → {'user_utterance': <class 'str'>}[source]¶

Forward function inherited from Module interface.

If this function has not been called before, do not pass a message. Otherwise, it blocks the application until the user has entered a message in the GUI.

Parameters

  • dialog_graph (DialogSystem) – The dialog system this module is part of. Useful to access other modules, turn and dialog counters etc.

  • **kwargs (dict) – Dictionary of information passing across modules, keys and values are defined according to the modules’ definition and interaction

Returns

a dict containing the user utterance which is automatically added to the kwargs

Return type

dict

start_dialog(**kwargs)[source]¶

Restarts the GUI.

This method is used in case of multiple dialogs, e.g. for evaluation. It simply clears the dialog GUI widget and resets initial_turn to True.

Parameters

**kwargs (dict) – Dictionary of information passing across modules, keys and values are defined according to the modules’ definition and interaction

Returns

an empty dict

Return type

dict

  • **kwargs (dict) – Dictionary of information passing across modules, keys and values are defined according to the modules’ definition and interaction

Returns

an empty dict, since nothing is added to the kwargs

class TaskDescription(domain: utils.domain.domain.Domain = None, subgraph: dict = None, logger: utils.logger.DiasysLogger = <DiasysLogger adviser (NOTSET)>)[source]¶

Bases: modules.module.Module

Displays the task description inside the GUI

The module blocks until the user has read the description. It will automatically appear at the start of a dialogue.

initial_turn¶

whether this is the first turn of the dialogue

Type

bool

description¶

what should be shown to the user

Type

str

dialogs¶

dialogue counter

Type

int

forward(dialog_graph: dialogsystem.DialogSystem, **kwargs) → {}[source]¶

Forward function inherited from Module interface.

When this function is called for the first time, this method will display the task description and block until the user has clicked the task-read button.

Parameters

  • dialog_graph (DialogSystem) – The dialog system this module is part of. Useful to access other modules, turn and dialog counters etc.

  • **kwargs (dict) – Dictionary of information passing across modules, keys and values are defined according to the modules’ definition and interaction

Returns

an empty dict, since nothing is added to the kwargs

set_task_description(description)[source]¶

Setter for the task description

Parameters

description (str) – the description of the task

close_permanently()[source]¶

Sends the GUI the message to close itself.

init_gui()[source]¶

Initialises the GUI application.

If the GUI has already been initialised, nothing is done.
